questions.question: What is the temperature range used for the incorporation of nitrogen-containing azolates into MOF-520?
True or False: Sulfur oxoacids were incorporated into MOF-520 at temperatures ranging from 85–100 °C.
What method involves the coordinative attachment of the molecule of interest to the backbone of a chiral metal–organic framework (MOF), specifically MOF-520?
How many days were nitrogen-containing azolates immersed in DMF solutions for incorporation into MOF-520?
True or False: Phosphorus oxoacids were incorporated into MOF-520 by immersion in solutions at temperatures of 85–100 °C.
What is the role of formic acid in the synthesis of MOF-520 single crystals?
questions.answer: Formic acid is added to the mixture before heating to assist in the formation of MOF-520 single crystals.

questions.question: True or False: The CAL method allows for the determination of the single-crystal X-ray structure and absolute configuration of bound molecules.
What new categories of functionalities were successfully crystallized in MOF-520 according to the text?
questions.answer: Nitrogen-containing azolates, sulfur-containing oxoacids, and phosphorus-containing oxoacids
